intro: Terminthodia, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Terminthodia produces bright yellow to orange flowers that bloom in spring and summer.
